title: Creating a Common Denominator
text: We must find the LCD in order to be able to add the fractions. The LCM of $$xy-y^2$$ and $$x^2-y^2$$ is $$\left(xy-y^2\right) \left(x^2-y^2\right)$$
speech: We must find the LCD in order to be able to add the fractions. The LCM of  x y minus, y squared  and  x squared, minus y squared  is  parentheses, x y minus y squared  times, parentheses, x squared minus y squared,
pacedSpeech: We must find the LCD in order to be able to add the fractions. The LCM of   x y minus, y squared
and   x squared, minus y squared
is   , x y minus y squared  times, , x squared minus y squared,

title: Rewriting Each Fraction
text: We can rewrite each fraction with a common scaler to get $$\frac{5x\left(x^2-y^2\right)}{\left(xy-y^2\right) \left(x^2-y^2\right)}+\frac{2x\left(xy-y^2\right)}{\left(xy-y^2\right) \left(x^2-y^2\right)}$$
speech: We can rewrite each fraction with a common scaler to get  fraction, 5 x, parentheses, x squared minus y squared, , over, parentheses, x y minus y squared  times, parentheses, x squared minus y squared, ,  plus fraction, 2 x, parentheses, x y minus y squared , over, parentheses, x y minus y squared  times, parentheses, x squared minus y squared, ,
pacedSpeech: We can rewrite each fraction with a common scaler to get  this expression

title: Adding the Fractions
speech: Adding the fractions, we get  fraction, 5 x, parentheses, x squared minus y squared,  plus 2 x, parentheses, x y minus y squared , over, parentheses, x y minus y squared  times, parentheses, x squared minus y squared, ,
pacedSpeech: Adding the fractions, we get  this expression
